page.title: 19LAND SHAPE IN THE STUDY AREA
page.content: {Our area}is mostly valley.Not steep valleys but long low hills.The hills roll from valley to valley.There are trees and woodlands.They grow round the river.Horrabridge is on the {Walkham valley .Tributaries}run in to the{Walkham}down the sides of the valley.Wier park in{Horrabridge}is a flood plane.The river doesn't flood annually but is liable to suffer from flash floods.The land slopes gently down from{Dartmoor}which is a{granite batholith,harder than it'surroundings so it has been less eroded. {The main rocks}to be found in the area are granite , slate and shale. In many places bands of quartz can be found, often containing{copper , tin or other metals.
